name: Financial subsidiaries in other countries  : Annex 6 : Total number of financial subsidiaries broken down by location in other countries : Number : Data collection on voluntary basis : Other credit granting : Luxembourg : Spain
description:
Structural business statistics on credit institutions are harmonised statistics on the structure, activity, performance and competitiveness of credit institutions. Credit institutions are defined in Article 1 of the Council Directive 77/780/EEC: 'credit institution means an undertaking whose business is to receive deposits or other repayable funds from the public and to grant credits for its own account'.
Credit institutions are normally authorised and registered by the national central banks or by the competent national financial supervisory authority. In the frame of prudential supervision the credit institutions concerned are obliged to submit comprehensive sets of data to the supervisory authorities. The structural business statistics on credit institutions are to a large extent based on this information.
The Credstat collection includes:
demographic statistics (number of enterprises (+breakdowns), number of local units, number of branches, etc.), 
accounting variables,
variables by product,
variables on internationalisation,
variables on employment,
regional statistics

Full metadata at: http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/cache/ITY_SDDS/EN/sbs_cre_esms.htm
